HAVING TROUBLE WITH SUBTITLES?
HERE'S WHY:

The subtitles need to be re-named to be EXACTLY the same as their AVI counterpart.

IE: "The godfather 1 english.sub"  needs to be re-named to: "God father part I.sub" 
( MINUS QUOTATION MARKS - ***Notice the SPACE between "God" and "father" - this is the only one with the space...).

The rest should read:
"Godfather part II.sub" and
"Godfather part III.sub"

ALSO: You'll get better response from "DirectVobSub" if you put each movie and associated subtitle file in it's own folder.

That is, of course, if you've got the
"DirectVobSub - (auto-loading version)" plug-in installed.

If you don't, download "Combined Community Codec Pack (C.C.C.P. - Google it - it's free).

TOOK ME A COUPLE OF MINUTES TO FIGURE OUT WHAT THE PROBLEM WAS HERE. 
THIS SOLUTION WORKS FOR ME,
HOPE IT HELPS SOME OF YOU!

PEACE,
=doublèdgè=
